tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Dream Gardens
programme.desc: This Australian series begins with a rural Queensland couples journey to transform a rock hard paddock into an ambitious and extensive kitchen garden so that they can live out their "grow it, eat it, live it" dream.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Melissa Mackay.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Vera Stanhope investigates the mysterious death of a young man whose remains are discovered in remote caves in an area notorious for illicit teenage gatherings.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: The final week of Question Time for 2025 begins with coverage from the Senate.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: In an Australian Story special, former politician and Midnight Oil frontman Peter Garrett opens up to Leigh Sales about love, loss and living large.

programme.title: I Was Actually There
programme.desc: Its a day etched into Australian sporting folklore for all the wrong reasons. A moment on a footy field where Nicky Winmar, a proud Noongar man, called out racism.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: Parliament resumes for the final sitting week of 2025. Coverage of Question Time from the House of Representatives.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Tino Carnevale shares his tips for perfect soil, Josh Byrne sets up his garden for tomatoes, Jerry Coleby-Williams meets a tropical fruit expert, and Sophie Thomson plants a herb garden to complement her outdoor pizza oven.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Call The Midwife: Christmas Special
programme.desc: With Christmas approaching, the midwives move to their maternity clinic and are delighted when their first patient is a familiar face. Life in Poplar returns to normal and everyone unites for a festive talent show.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: The final sitting week of 2025 continues in the House of Representatives with coverage of Question Time.

programme.title: When The War Is Over
programme.desc: Rachel Griffiths sits down with some Aussie rock legends, and heads to the jungles of Vietnam in a bid to understand the music that united a divided nation.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: A look at how World War II played out on the Home Front, featuring Churchills secret loo, the heroic ATA Girls, and German Spies being caught out by their delicious sausages...

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Everything from roads to baths to pies, hosts Emperor Nero and warrior queen Boudicca are here to show what the Romans did while they were here in Britain

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: With A-Troupe all in on Regionals, Pete takes his eyes off The Brawl and auditions for Dance Captain. Olive looks for a place she belongs as Grace dreams of joining A-Troupe.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: A fox arrives at the farm, disguising himself as a handsome ram to infiltrate the flock.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Welcome to the scab factory. The doctors investigate which part of your body heals the fastest, mouth versus knee! Plus in the emergency department, Sophie has a screw in her foot!

programme.title: Gladiators UK
programme.desc: Fury hits hard on the Edge, and Phantom ghosts his opponent in Duel, as the contenders battle it out for a place in the grand final.

programme.title: Officially Amazing
programme.sub-title: Why Are Some People Faster Than Others?
programme.desc: Witness some bubble magic and noodle record breaking. If thats not enough, gaze in wonder at the worlds largest shoe collection. Ben oversees a tricking attempt, and in India theres an attempt to zip line with the hair.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Rattus enlists HH songwriter Richie for a show in which everything is a song!

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: No longer Dance Captain, Anthony finds following orders difficult. Jett and Ariana try to be friends again while Heaths history with Daisy complicates things with Pascale.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The sheep have fun with the Farmers new pool table.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Did you know youre mostly made of water? Find out how as the doctors say hello to your hypothalamus - the amazing part of your brain that keeps you hydrated.

programme.title: Animals Up Close With Bertie Gregory
programme.desc: Bertie travels to the Galapagos. His mission: find and film three unique animal behaviours seen nowhere else on Earth.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!: Do Try This At Home
programme.desc: Dr Chris and Dr Xand have brought their lab into Xands kitchen! In todays episode, the doctors look at eyes, and show you an experiment to find your blind spot!

programme.title: Louis Theroux Interviews...
programme.desc: Louis Theroux spends time with singer-songwriter Rachel Keen - better known as Raye - during a career defining year, at home in South London, backstage at Glastonbury and working on new material in the recording studio.

programme.title: Adam Hills: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by comedians Nish Kumar and Fern Brady for an entertaining, off-beat look at the big stories of the past seven days. (Final)

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors choose some of their favourite moments including an experiment to find out what happens when you cough and a life-changing operation that allows someone to hear for the very first time.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Rematch With Goku Black! Enter Super Saiyan Rose
programme.desc: Future Trunks, Vegeta and Goku finally use the time machine with intention to confront Black. But when they arrive, theyre greeted by a familiar face and an unfamiliar power. Will they be able to stand up to this new threat?

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Flock hear the enticing tunes of an ice cream van approaching and quickly hatch a plan to divert it into their field. While the driver seeks help, the Flock have great fun with an endless supply of ice cream.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: Shaggy competes against singer Halsey in a poetry slam.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: Three brother bears awkwardly attempt to find their place in civilized society. Following the shenanigans of baby versions of Grizzly, Panda, and Ice Bear as they tackle on a whole new world together.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.sub-title: Teach A Man To Ice Fish Part 1
programme.desc: When the villain, Confetti Betty, strikes the Odd Squad headquarters in the Arctic, the Mobile Unit returns to help Opal and Omars old squad.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Operation Ouch! doctors explore the incredible human ears, showing everything from what they look like inside, to how your eardrums send sound waves to your brain and why you need sticky ear wax.

programme.title: Bitesize Daily
programme.desc: Learn about longitude and latitude, locating a place and comparing time zones.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Shep and Raul respond to a massive house fire without proper gear, risking their lives to save addicts and their children. Dougs relationship with his father worsens. Lewis learns her fate regarding plans to adopt her niece.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Adam and Jamie set out to see if you can fly a normal raft filled with helium and, do cell phones cause airplanes to crash?

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil heads to West Yorkshire to help Alan, Wendy and their teenage daughters sell their family home of eight years. Phil tries to work out why this three-bed semi has been on the market without an offer for over two years.

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.sub-title: Can a Bison Buffalo Penn and Teller?
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Marco Grandia, Sylvain Juzan, Alexander Merk and Keona. (Final)

programme.title: rage Guest Programmer: BBNO$
programme.desc: Join Vancouver viral-sensation and musical mischief-maker BBNO$ as he guest programs rage, serving up a playlist thats almost as chaotic as he is.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Break out the Bolly! Coughing and spluttering their way into the 21st century, the outrageous Edina, Patsy and co are back.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Chris and Dr Xand take a look at what happens to your body and why, when you reach puberty. Dr Xand finds out why you sweat more and Dr Chris discovers the real reason teens dont want to get up in the morning.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: A God With An Invincible Body The Advent Of Zamasu
programme.desc: With Vegeta out of the fight, Goku and Future Trunks must fight Future Zamasu and Black with a man down. But can they hope to defeat an opponent who brushes off even the strongest attacks?

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: When Shauns old friend the Alien drops by for a loo break, Shaun is only too happy to let him use the facilities in the farmhouse. While hes going about his business he leaves Shaun in charge of his intriguing new gadget.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: The gang teams up with Steve Buscemi in Sicily.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: Three brother bears awkwardly attempt to find their place in civilized society. Following the shenanigans of baby versions of Grizzly, Panda, and Ice Bear as they tackle on a whole new world together.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.sub-title: Teach A Man To Ice Fish Part 2
programme.desc: When the villain, Confetti Betty, strikes the Odd Squad headquarters in the Arctic, the Mobile Unit returns to help Opal and Omars old squad.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Operation Ouch! doctors explore the incredible human eye, showing everything from what yours are made of, to how they enable you to see and why you need tears.

programme.title: Sciencexplosion
programme.desc: Order is important! Eric learns about th e coded instructions that make computers and robots work! Its not magic, its science, its STEM!

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil heads to West Yorkshire to help Alan, Wendy and their teenage daughters sell their family home of eight years. Phil tries to work out why this three-bed semi has been on the market without an offer for over two years.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Lewis takes extra precautions in case Chloe tries to reclaim Susie. Mark tries a cooler image by growing a goatee and wearing contacts. Carter risks both his patient and his job by over-celebrating his residency match.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil is in the market town of Haslemere, Surrey taking on a maisonette that wont sell and an owner that should know better. Owner Kimberley is also an estate agent, so she spends her working life selling houses in her area.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy are extras on the set of a famous TV mini-series. Unfortunately, Lee gets ideas above his station and sets his sights on an acting role.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: The Tombliboos take a ride on the Ninky Nonk; it goes past Igglepiggle, then Upsy Daisy and then Makka Pakka.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Hoopla is in a mess after a big storm and Jango thinks its too hard to clean up. So he pretends to be sick and tricks his friends into doing his work for him.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.sub-title: Daniel And Miss Elaina Bake Pretzels
programme.desc: At the bakery, Daniel is rolling his dough way too close to Miss Elaina. When Miss Elaina asks nicely for some more space, they each stay on their own baking mats and enjoy making "deeelicious" pretzels together.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing helps Flop do the shopping at Padgets shop but whilst Flop is paying he finds a strawberry lolly that he cant resist putting in his pocket.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa brings home a Teddy from Playgroup to look after, but she is worried that he wont have a very exciting time.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Every time the postman pays the Farmer a visit, Bitzers canine instincts get the better of him, resulting in shredded mail and an irate farmer. Shaun decides to help out by taking on the role of Bitzers therapist...

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Daisy and Poppy turn Nanny Plum into a doll and soon the fairy toy becomes very popular - everyone wants one!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Everyone is getting ready for Mr Bull and Mrs Cows wedding. Peppa and the soon-to-be-weds go to the jewellers to get rings, to the dress makers, to get a wedding dress... and finally, Peppas house to sort the wedding cake.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: When Ginger gets stung by an Appleflyus it leaves a painful and incredibly itchy sore but, the only way to cure it is with the tail of an Appleflyus!

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Dad gets a severe case of Proximan hiccups. Big Lizard and Cosima do their best to help, but their attempt to scare Dad goes wrong when a real monster turns up!

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Emma and Teo meet Kate and Peter, two fire fighters! We learn about the practice of cultural burning and fire fighters, Kiya and Jemima rescue Humpty off a wall! Through The Windows, we see more fire fighters in an animation.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When noisy swans threaten to disrupt Carlos and Drews band performance, the Dream Factory Crew have to find a clever way to lead them away.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Rock Band
programme.desc: Nikhil and Jay start their own rock band! But Nikhil is deflated when Jay keeps inviting other people to join the band. Nikhil wants it to be just the two of them.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector follows a mysterious sound all the way to a hot house. What can it be?

programme.title: Bananas In Pyjamas
programme.desc: Morgan wants to be like his hero - Super Bear - but discovers being a super hero isnt as easy as it looks.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join The Wiggles and their Wiggly friends and enjoy songs from around the world! Special guest Bernadette Mate joins The Wiggles, and we learn about the Ukulele - its always a wonderful time on Wiggle and Learn!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Today the new baby seat has arrived, but the family car has no room for it! With help from Peppa and George, Daddy Pig chooses a bigger car for the family.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: To plug an air vent at the bottom of the lake, Ginger and the Baby Pea-Rexes must seek the help of the mighty Watermelonsuchus!

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Ottos stinky feet smell like cheese. Vida helps and everyone is happy except Sunny, who loves cheese!

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Harbour Seal
programme.desc: When Pesos patient, a remora fish, mysteriously disappears, the Octonauts enlist a unique undersea detective - a harbour seal.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Luna and Motsuki drop Lunas magnet in the moat, and are silly enough to accept Octobellas help getting it.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Yong Bao tells Thomas the story of how he came to have a magnificent tiger emblem on his tender.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Hannah and the junior gardeners celebrate her goats Gilly and Gerties birthday with a special fruity surprise a fruit cake made entirely out of fruit!

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join The Wiggles as they explore the excitement of preschool life! Buddy takes you through a day at preschool, from morning routines to playtime and arts and crafts.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and family find some great things to buy from the market and even get a special gift from Mr Foxs stall.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima, Big Lizard and Ammon are squabbling over Dads precious Explorer Notebook. When disaster strikes, only by working together can they save it from being lost forever!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Its the hottest day of summer and while Gemma leads a dolphin rescue, Pounce is determined to prove kangaroos can beat the heat.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Gekko wants to stop a speedy Night Ninja - but his lumbering lizards just too slow

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.sub-title: Paddington Becomes A Talent Show Judge
programme.desc: Its the Windsor Gardens Pet show, Paddington is the judge but theyre all so talented how can he choose?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.sub-title: Daisy And Poppy Go To The Museum
programme.desc: Daisy and Poppy and their toddler friends are taken on a trip to the big museum by their teacher Mrs Fotheringill. The naughty toddlers cause chaos and before too long Mrs Fotheringill, has been zapped back to the stone-age.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Buff befriends Mr. Freezes snowcrawler "Snowy".

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: The Pontipines are eating their Pontipine dinner, when Mr Pontipines moustache flies off! First it gets stuck on the chimney, then the bridge and then the gazebo.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: It is the Lantern Festival and Bop needs help to make the lanterns. If Zap helps Bop make lanterns, who will do his deliveries? If Mimi does deliveries who will make the dumplings? Soon everyone in town has traded places.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: When Daniel and O are playing library at Os treehouse, O sits too close to Daniel, which makes it hard to read his book.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are both tired but insist on one last game of Hide and Seek before bed. Pando finds a great hiding place under the covers of Bings bed but by the time Bing finds him hes fast asleep.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its Danny Dogs birthday, and with the help of Grandad Dog and Grandpa Pig, the children take part in a pirate treasure hunt.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The flock are off for a girls night, leaving Bitzer to Babysit Timmy. Its not long before the youngster makes it clear whos in charge.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Redbeard the Elf Pirate sets sail to find the lost city, but soon finds himself in trouble and in need of rescuing.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is the day of Mrs Cow and Mr Bulls wedding but not everything goes to plan... But none of this stops it being the best wedding ever and there is a lot of happy crying!

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: When a young Cornasaurolophus strays from its herd and befriends Ginger and the Peas, all is fine until it starts popping which draws attention of the Bananaraptors!

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: When Cosima finally finds a quiet place to read her book, she realises that peace and quiet arent all theyre made out to be. Wheres Big Lizard when you need him?

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Emma and Kaeng meet Sara, a police officer with a bicycle! They inspect Saras bicycle with Constable Maurice, and theres an exciting police rescue mission! Through The Windows, we see more police officers in an animation.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory - and their Twin-Bots - save the Robotics competition when Biff and Tiffs robots go wild.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Adventure Park
programme.desc: Nikhil and Jay are pretending to be at an adventure park with rides all around the house. Jay is devastated when he loses his beloved toy, Chickpea, along the way.

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie goes to the cinema with Akil and Nina, learning to enjoy himself even when it gets a little noisy.

programme.title: Bananas In Pyjamas
programme.desc: Rat boasts to the Bananas and Teddies that hes a great surfer. The Bananas and Teddies would love to see Rat perform some surf tricks.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join The Wiggles in the enchanting world of dolls! Dorothy needs assistance with her Dorothy doll, so they call on Dolly Dr. Sahara for help. Will she be able to save the day?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and family find some great things to buy from the market and even get a special gift from Mr Foxs stall.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima and Big Lizard investigate the cause of Dads mysterious sleepwalking in an adventure that takes them around Proxima and right back home again.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: Tiff finds herself in a pickle when Biff goes off to play pickle ball, leaving her to come up with an invention for the "Reuse, Recycle, Reward!" competition on her own.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: Kwazii and Dashi become entangled in a strange deep-sea creature - a siphonophore - and when a geyser blasts it toward the surface, the Octonauts must stop its ascent before it fatally bursts.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: After bird watching with Duggee, the Squirrels are excited to learn more about the natural world around them with a helping hand from Duggee.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Gordon and Rebecca do the same work - but they go about it differently. When Rebecca tries to be more like Gordon, it doesnt go well... for Gordon!

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Clarence and Molly go on the ultimate adventure to find the coolest bugs in the garden.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join The Wiggles as they explore the importance of safety in all areas of life, from home to sleep and the road. Look both ways and sing along to Stop at the Lights, then count to twenty with Anthony!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are helping Grandpa pig to dig a brand new pond for his garden!

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: When a giant beetle steals D.O.R.I.S.s brain, thinking its a nut, Cosima and Big Lizard give chase through the forest. Big Lizards unique skills rescue poor D.O.R.I.S.s super-brain.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Its Carnival Day at Kangaroo Beach, with two teams competing in lifeguard games. But its the young cadets versus the lifeguards - how can they possibly win against a stellar team of grown-up champions?

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Night Ninja sets up a school for villains.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Baaz has set up a mini golf course at the park, but is it really unbeatable like he says and how should you hold a club Paddington?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: It is Fathers Day in The Little Kingdom and all the dads are given a day off work to go and play together in the meadow. Ben and Holly are surprised to learn that The Wise Old Elf is a dad too, with three sons of his own.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bam causes the Batwing to crash.

programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.sub-title: First Ashes Test Special from Perth
programme.desc: Australia chase 205 runs to win the First Ashes Test after 19 wickets fell on Day 1 and Mitchell Starc took 10. Abbey Gelmi joins Bharat Sundaresan, Alison Mitchell and Corbin Middlemas at Perth Stadium to discuss the action.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: An ambitious project harnessing the outback sun gets the go ahead, traditional owners seek inspiration to recreate the Juukan Gorge rock shelter, and Australias longest running radio program celebrates a big milestone.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As the day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. Bridget Brennan and James Glenday bring you the latest news, overnight developments and todays top stories, joined by Charles Brice, Catherine Murphy and Nate Byrne.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Kathryn Robinson brings you todays top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter most.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: Parliament resumes for the final sitting week of 2025 in the House of Representatives. Live coverage of Question Time.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Ukraines choice: losing dignity or risk losing a major partner. Trump sets Zelenskyy a Thanksgiving deadline to decide. Plus Marjorie Taylor Greene to quit Congress in January after a falling out with Trump. (Final for 2025)

Sarah Ferguson is in Canberra for the final sitting week of the parliamentary year, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland and Jacob Greber.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Join Yvonne Yong for the news from Asia: Bangladeshs ousted leader Sheikh Hasina sentenced to death, arrests made over Delhis deadly bomb attack, plus a success story from Chinese dating show If You Are The One.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: If Youre Listening
programme.sub-title: The truth about Chinas social credit scores
programme.desc: For the last decade or so, theres been a lot of talk about how the Chinese government uses technology to issue social credit scores to its citizens. But does this dystopian AI powered surveillance system actually even exist?

Sarah Ferguson is in Canberra for the final sitting week of the parliamentary year, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland and Jacob Greber.
